brief: To make the most of your quiz questions, be sure to follow the best practices laid out in this article, and check out the resources provided below.

stems.text: What are the main concepts of multiple-choice questions?
Which of the following statements about effective stems are true

choices.C: Avoid grammatical clues (e.g., a or an, singular or plural)
choices.D: Use negative constructors often (e.g., not and except)
choices.E: Don't leak information that provides clues for other questions

explains.text: If you must use a negative construction, be sure to underline or bold words such as not or except

stems.text: Just to reminds you the characteristics of effective response items:
- Ensure that every response is grammatically consistent with the stem
- Make sure response items have a parallel grammatical structure
- Avoid idioms and potentially confusing vocabulary
- Avoid absolutes (e.g., always and never)
- Make sure the position of the correct answer varies
- Make the length of response items roughly consistent
- Eliminate repetitive or extraneous wording
- Ensure that all items are mutually exclusive (i.e., avoid overlapping alternatives)
- List response options in a logical order (e.g., alphabetically, chronologically, or numerically)
- Avoid potentially confusing response items such as “A and B” or “B and C.” If there is more than one correct answer, use multiple-answer questions instead
- Avoid using all of the above and none of the above, but if you do use them, use them generously and not just when they’re the correct answer.
Please read the following question first:
What is the average effective radiation dose from a chest CT?
A. 1–10 mSv
B. 10–12 mSv
C. 24–32 mSv
D. 16–24 mSv
Can you spot the problems with the response items?

choices.B: They are not in a logical order
choices.C: They don't have a parallel grammatical structure

explains.text: The grammatical structure is obviously parallel, even the lengths of them.
A better version of the question can be:
What is the average effective radiation dose from a chest CT?

stems.text: Which of the following statements about effective distractors are true

choices.B: Don't use trivial or nonsensical distractors
choices.C: Take advantage of mistakes that users often make
choices.D: Generate distractors from correct response items

explains.text: All of the above are directly mentioned in the original material

stems.text: Don't forget the feedback for each response and distractor, it's a chance that you can help them understand the reasoning better and point out the learning resources.
Please read the following question first:
Annuals are ______.
A. plants that live and bloom for multiple years
B. do not bloom
C. plants that live and bloom for one year
D. plants that bloom exclusively in cold climates
Can you spot the problems with the question?

choices.B: The response items have repetitive or extraneous wording
choices.C: The response items don't have a parallel grammatical structure
choices.D: The response items don't match the stem grammatically
choices.E: The response items use idioms and potentially confusing vocabulary

explains.text: There is no idioms and confusing vocabulary in response items
A better version of the question can be:
Which of the following is true of annuals? They ___.
A. live and bloom for multiple years
C. bloom exclusively in cold climates
D. live and bloom for one year
